alert.note: Alert for Northwest Plateau; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued September 30 at 8:11PM MDT until October 01 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FOR SUNDAY FOR THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU AND WEST CENTRAL MOUNTAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE AIR MASS... .A Pacific storm system will continue to move inland and strengthen over the Great Basin through Sunday. This disturbance will continue to spread strong winds, dry conditions, and unstable air over portions of northwestern to west central New Mexico Sunday. This will lead to areas of critical fire weather conditions, especially along and west of the Continental Divide. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau (Zone 101) and West Central Mountains (Zone 105) from early afternoon through early this evening Sunday, especially along and west of the Continental Divide. * 20 FOOT WINDS...South winds strengthening to 25 to 35 mph with gusts of 40 to 50 mph on Sunday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 13 to 18 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
